Description: An amulet of variegated limestone: in the form of the head of a bull, with indications of the eyes, horns and mouth being shown in the carving. The object is pierced horizontally at the back for suspension, the hole having been drilled from opposite sides to meet in the centre.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: G. Brunton, 'British Museum expedition to Middle Egypt, 1929-1931 Matmar' (London, 1948), pl. XXII, 30.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
